# Atlas Games - Official Website **Games Built to Endure** - Official website for Atlas Games, an indie game studio creating memorable gaming experiences that stand the test of time. ## Live Site Visit us at: [atlasgames22.github.io](https://atlasgames22.github.io) ## Project Overview Atlas Games is a production-ready static website built for GitHub Pages hosting. The site showcases our indie game studio, complete game catalog, team information, development blog, and company story. ### Brand Identity - **Studio Name:** Atlas Games - **Tagline:** Games Built to Endure - **Theme:** Dark-first with light mode toggle - **Colors:** Crimson Red (#C62828), Charcoal Black (#121212), Steel Grey (#4F4F4F), Off-White (#F2F2F2) - **Typography:** Poppins (Google Fonts) with system fallbacks ## ️ Project Structure ``` / ├─ index.html # Homepage with hero, featured games, values ├─ games.html # Games catalog with filtering and search ├─ game.html # Game detail template (query param driven) ├─ team.html # Team member profiles with modals ├─ blog.html # Blog listing with pagination and filters ├─ post.html # Blog post detail template (query param driven) ├─ about.html # Company story, mission, and values ├─ contact.html # Contact form and information ├─ assets/ │ ├─ logo/ │ │ ├─ atlas-logo.svg # Main logo (placeholder SVG) │ │ └─ favicon.png # Site favicon (placeholder) │ ├─ images/ │ │ ├─ hero.jpg # Hero section image (placeholder) │ │ ├─ team/ # Team member photos (placeholders) │ │ │ ├─ luke.jpg │ │ │ ├─ liam.jpg │ │ │ └─ keagan.jpg │ │ └─ games/ # Game thumbnails and screenshots (placeholders) │ └─ icons/ # SVG icons (inline in HTML) ├─ data/ │ ├─ games.json # Complete game catalog (16 games) │ ├─ team.json # Team member information (3 founders) │ └─ posts.json # Blog posts (5 sample posts) ├─ styles/ │ ├─ main.css # Base styles, typography, layout │ ├─ components.css # UI components (cards, buttons, nav, etc.) │ └─ utilities.css # CSS variables, utility classes, animations ├─ scripts/ │ ├─ app.js # Core app functionality, theme toggle, navigation │ ├─ router.js # Client-side routing for detail pages │ ├─ renderGames.js # Games page functionality and filtering │ ├─ renderTeam.js # Team page functionality │ └─ renderPosts.js # Blog functionality with pagination ├─ seo/ │ ├─ sitemap.xml # Complete XML sitemap │ ├─ robots.txt # Search engine directives │ └─ schema-org.json # JSON-LD structured data ├─ .well-known/ │ └─ security.txt # Security contact information └─ README.md # This file ``` ## Game Catalog Our website features 16 games across multiple genres: ### Released Games - **Wobbly Wiggles Series** (1, 2, 3: Ultimate Racers Diamond/Onyx) - **Harvest Hustle** - Farming simulation with time management - **Kenny's Khaos** - Chaotic arcade action - **Tiny Cafe** - Cozy cafe management - **Void Breaker** - Space-themed brick breaker - **Honey Haven** - Bee colony management - **McDonald's Advergame** - Promotional game ### In Development - **Timmy's Revenge** - 2D platformer (Q2 2025) - **From The Shadows** - Atmospheric horror (Q3 2025) - **Cancer Crusher** - Educational puzzle game (Q2 2025) - **CapsuleWars** - Strategic battle game (Beta Q1 2025) - **Cardmageddon** - Post-apocalyptic card game (Q3 2025) - **Capture & Conquest** - Territory control RTS (Q4 2025) ## Team - **Luke Rall** - Co-founder / Designer / Producer - **Liam Schultz** - Co-founder / Developer - **Keagan Du Plessis** - Co-founder / Artist/Animator ## Getting Started ### Local Development 1. **Clone the repository:** ```bash git clone https://github.com/atlasgames22/atlasgames22.github.io.git cd atlasgames22.github.io ``` 2. **Serve locally:** **Option A: Python (if installed)** ```bash python -m http.server 8000 ``` **Option B: Node.js (if installed)** ```bash npx http-server ``` **Option C: PHP (if installed)** ```bash php -S localhost:8000 ``` 3. **Open in browser:** Navigate to `http://localhost:8000` ### Direct File Access You can also simply open `index.html` directly in your browser for basic functionality. ## Content Management ### Adding a New Game 1. **Add game data** to `data/games.json`: ```json { "id": "new-game-slug", "slug": "new-game-slug", "title": "New Game Title", "shortDescription": "Brief description", "longDescription": "Detailed description", "genre": ["Genre1", "Genre2"], "platforms": ["PC", "Web"], "releaseStatus": "Released|Beta|In Development", "releaseDate": "YYYY-MM-DD", "itchUrl": "https://link-to-game", "thumbnail": "assets/images/games/new-game-thumb.jpg", "screenshots": ["path1.jpg", "path2.jpg"], "features": ["Feature 1", "Feature 2"] } ``` 2. **Add game images** to `assets/images/games/`: - Thumbnail: `new-game-thumb.jpg` (recommended: 400x300px) - Screenshots: Various sizes for gallery ### Adding a Blog Post 1. **Add post data** to `data/posts.json`: ```json { "id": "post-slug", "slug": "post-slug", "title": "Post Title", "author": "Author Name", "date": "YYYY-MM-DD", "excerpt": "Brief excerpt", "content": "

Full HTML content

", "coverImage": "assets/images/blog/cover.jpg", "tags": ["Tag1", "Tag2"] } ``` 2. **Add cover image** to `assets/images/blog/` ### Adding a Team Member 1. **Add member data** to `data/team.json`: ```json { "id": "member-slug", "name": "Full Name", "role": "Job Title", "shortBio": "Brief bio", "longBio": "Detailed bio", "skills": ["Skill1", "Skill2"], "photo": "assets/images/team/member.jpg", "links": { "twitter": "https://twitter.com/handle", "linkedin": "https://linkedin.com/in/profile" }, "joinDate": "YYYY-MM-DD", "favoriteGames": ["Game1", "Game2"], "quote": "Personal quote" } ``` 2. **Add photo** to `assets/images/team/` (recommended: 400x400px, square) ## Customization ### Theme Colors Edit CSS variables in `styles/utilities.css`: ```css :root { --color-primary: #C62828; /* Brand red */ --color-background: #121212; /* Dark background */ --color-secondary: #4F4F4F; /* Steel grey */ --color-light: #F2F2F2; /* Off-white */ } ``` ### Typography Change font family in `styles/utilities.css`: ```css --font-family-primary: 'Poppins', -apple-system, BlinkMacSystemFont, sans-serif; ``` ## Technical Features ### Accessibility (WCAG 2.1 AA) - Semantic HTML5 structure - Proper heading hierarchy - Alt text for images - Keyboard navigation support - Focus management and indicators - Screen reader friendly - Color contrast compliance - Skip to content links ### SEO Optimization - Complete meta tags (Open Graph, Twitter Cards) - XML sitemap with all pages - JSON-LD structured data - Semantic markup - Clean URLs with query parameters - Mobile-first responsive design ### Performance - No build tools required - Minimal JavaScript (vanilla JS only) - Optimized CSS with utility classes - Lazy loading for images - Efficient DOM manipulation ### Browser Support - Modern browsers (Chrome, Firefox, Safari, Edge) - Progressive enhancement approach - Graceful degradation for older browsers ## Responsive Design - **Mobile-first** approach - **Breakpoints:** - Small: 640px+ - Medium: 768px+ - Large: 1024px+ - Extra Large: 1280px+ ## Theme System - **Default:** Dark theme - **Auto-detection:** Respects `prefers-color-scheme` - **Manual toggle:** Persistent in localStorage - **Smooth transitions** between themes ## GitHub Pages Deployment ### Automatic Deployment 1. Push to `main` branch 2. GitHub Pages automatically builds and deploys 3. Site available at `https://atlasgames22.github.io` ### Manual Setup 1. Go to repository Settings 2. Navigate to Pages section 3. Set Source to "Deploy from a branch" 4. Select `main` branch and `/ (root)` 5. Save settings ## SEO Features - **Sitemap:** `/seo/sitemap.xml` - **Robots:** `/seo/robots.txt` - **Structured Data:** Organization, WebSite, VideoGame schemas - **Meta Tags:** Complete OpenGraph and Twitter Cards - **Canonical URLs:** Prevent duplicate content - **Performance:** Optimized for Core Web Vitals ## ️ Security - **Security Policy:** `/.well-known/security.txt` - **Content Security:** No external dependencies except Google Fonts - **Form Validation:** Client-side validation with fallbacks - **Safe Rendering:** Prevents XSS in dynamic content ## Contact Information - **Email:** atlasgamesstudio22@gmail.com - **Discord:** [Join our server](https://discord.gg/atlasgames) - **Itch.io:** [Our game store](https://atlasgames.itch.io) - **Twitter:** [@atlasgames22](https://twitter.com/atlasgames22) - **GitHub:** [@atlasgames22](https://github.com/atlasgames22) ## License © 2025 Atlas Games. All rights reserved. ## Asset Credits All images and assets are placeholders for demonstration purposes. Replace with actual studio assets: - **Logo:** Replace `assets/logo/atlas-logo.svg` with actual logo - **Favicon:** Replace `assets/logo/favicon.png` with actual favicon - **Team Photos:** Replace placeholder images in `assets/images/team/` - **Game Assets:** Replace placeholder images in `assets/images/games/` - **Blog Images:** Add actual blog post cover images to `assets/images/blog/` --- **Atlas Games** - Creating memorable gaming experiences that stand the test of time.

About Atlas Games

We're an indie game studio dedicated to creating games that stand the test of time. Like Atlas holding up the heavens, we support memorable gaming experiences that endure.

Our Mission

At Atlas Games, we believe games should be more than entertainment—they should be experiences that create lasting memories and bring people together.

Our mission is to craft games that endure beyond trends and technology cycles. We focus on timeless gameplay mechanics, meaningful player interactions, and stories that resonate across generations.

Our Core Values

Quality Craft

Every line of code, every pixel of art, and every sound effect is carefully crafted with attention to detail. We believe quality is never an accident—it's always the result of intelligent effort.

Community First

Our players are at the heart of everything we do. We actively listen to feedback, engage with our community, and create games that bring people together rather than divide them.

Lasting Impact

We design for longevity, creating games that remain engaging years after release. Our goal is to build experiences that players return to again and again, finding new joy each time.

Our Journey

The Beginning (2022)

Atlas Games was founded by three passionate developers who met through their shared love of creating unique gaming experiences. Starting with small experimental projects, we quickly discovered our shared vision for creating games that truly endure.

Our first major success came with the original Wobbly Wiggles, a physics-based party game that captured players' hearts with its simple yet engaging gameplay.

2022
Studio Founded
15+
Games Released

Growth & Evolution (2023-2024)

Building on our early success, we expanded our catalog with diverse games across multiple genres. From the farming simulation of Harvest Hustle to the chaotic action of Kenny's Khaos, we've continuously pushed our creative boundaries.

The Wobbly Wiggles series grew into a beloved franchise, culminating in the racing adventure of Wobbly Wiggles 3: Ultimate Racers.

Looking Forward (2025+)

As we enter 2025, we're excited about our upcoming projects including Timmy's Revenge, From The Shadows, and Cancer Crusher. Each represents our commitment to exploring new themes while maintaining the quality our community expects.

We're also expanding our educational game development with meaningful projects that combine entertainment with important social messages.

∞
Endless Possibilities

Report a Bug

Help us improve our games by sharing detailed information about issues you encounter. Your reports help us reproduce and fix problems quickly.

Need help first? Visit Support • Check System Requirements

What to Include in Your Report

  • Clear steps to reproduce - Detailed actions that trigger the bug
  • Expected vs. actual behavior - What should happen vs. what actually happens
  • Screenshots or logs - Visual evidence or error messages when possible
  • System details - Operating system, GPU/CPU model, RAM amount
  • Game build/version - Check the main menu or about screen for version info

Bug Report Form

Please fill out all required fields to help us investigate and resolve the issue.

Your Information

We'll use this to follow up on your report.

We'll send updates about the status of your bug report.

Game & Environment

Example: v0.5.2, Itch build #1234, or check the main menu for version info.

Severity & Frequency
Severity (required)
Bug Description

Maximum 120 characters. Be specific and concise.

List clear steps: 1. Open the game 2. Click on... 3. The bug occurs when...

What should happen when you follow those steps?

What actually happens? Include any error messages.

Any other relevant information, workarounds you've tried, etc.

System Details

Include the specific version number when possible.

Processor model if known.

Graphics card model if known.

Amount of system memory.

Optional: Share a link to a screenshot showing the issue.

Optional: Share a link to log files or crash reports.

Note: File uploads are not supported yet. Please use image sharing services like Imgur or file sharing services like Google Drive, and paste the share links above.
Consent & Privacy

By submitting this report, you agree to our Privacy Policy and Terms of Service. We'll only use your information to investigate and resolve the reported issue.

Thank You for Your Report!

We've received your bug report and will investigate the issue. You can expect a reply from our team within 2-3 business days with updates or follow-up questions.

Return to Support Center

Related Resources

Careers at Atlas Games

Join a passionate team dedicated to crafting exceptional gaming experiences. We value craftsmanship, creativity, and the impact each individual brings to our shared vision.

Why Join Atlas Games

Craftsmanship Focus

We prioritize quality over quantity, creating polished experiences that endure.

Small Team Impact

Your contributions directly shape our games and studio direction.

Remote-Friendly

Work from anywhere with flexible hours and asynchronous collaboration.

Learning Culture

Continuous growth through mentorship, workshops, and learning stipends.

Open Positions

We hire based on talent and cultural fit rather than strict timelines. Don't see your ideal role? We accept rolling applications for exceptional candidates.

Game Developer (Unity/C#)

Mid-Level • Remote/Contract
Location: Remote / South Africa preferred

Build gameplay systems, optimize performance, and bring creative visions to life using Unity and C#.

View Details Apply Now

Technical Artist

Mid-Level • Contract/Remote
Location: Remote / South Africa preferred

Bridge art and programming, create tools, optimize assets, and establish efficient art pipelines.

View Details Apply Now

UI/UX Designer

Junior-Mid • Part-time/Remote
Location: Remote worldwide

Design intuitive interfaces and seamless user experiences that enhance gameplay immersion.

View Details Apply Now

Community Manager

Junior-Mid • Part-time/Remote
Location: Remote worldwide

Build and nurture our gaming community across Discord, social media, and streaming platforms.

View Details Apply Now

Game Developer (Unity/C#) - Detailed Description

Responsibilities

  • Implement gameplay mechanics and systems using Unity and C#
  • Optimize game performance across multiple platforms
  • Collaborate with designers to prototype and iterate on features
  • Write clean, maintainable code following established patterns
  • Debug and resolve technical issues throughout development
  • Participate in code reviews and technical discussions
  • Contribute to technical documentation and knowledge sharing

Nice-to-Haves

  • 2+ years of Unity development experience
  • Experience with multiplayer networking
  • Knowledge of shader programming
  • Mobile game development experience
  • Familiarity with version control (Git)
  • Published game projects or portfolio

Tools & Technologies

  • Unity 2022.3+ and C#
  • Git and collaborative workflows
  • Visual Studio or JetBrains Rider
  • Agile development methodologies

Application Requirements

  • Resume highlighting relevant experience
  • Portfolio or Itch.io page showcasing your work
  • GitHub or code samples demonstrating Unity/C# skills
  • Cover letter explaining your interest in Atlas Games

Technical Artist - Detailed Description

Responsibilities

  • Create and maintain art production pipelines and tools
  • Optimize 3D models, textures, and animations for performance
  • Develop custom shaders and visual effects
  • Bridge communication between art and programming teams
  • Establish technical art standards and documentation
  • Troubleshoot and resolve art-related technical issues
  • Research and implement new rendering techniques

Nice-to-Haves

  • Experience with Unity's HDRP/URP pipelines
  • Proficiency in Maya, Blender, or 3ds Max
  • Shader development (HLSL/ShaderGraph)
  • Python or C# scripting for tool development
  • VFX creation (Particle systems, Niagara, etc.)
  • Performance profiling and optimization experience

Tools & Technologies

  • Unity 2022.3+ and rendering pipelines
  • 3D modeling and animation software
  • Photoshop and texture creation tools
  • Version control systems (Git, Perforce)

Application Requirements

  • Resume with technical art experience
  • Portfolio showcasing tools, shaders, and optimizations
  • Examples of technical problem-solving
  • Cover letter detailing your technical art philosophy

UI/UX Designer - Detailed Description

Responsibilities

  • Design intuitive game interfaces and menus
  • Create wireframes, prototypes, and design specifications
  • Conduct user testing and iterate based on feedback
  • Collaborate with developers on implementation
  • Maintain design systems and style guides
  • Design promotional materials and marketing assets
  • Ensure accessibility compliance in all designs

Nice-to-Haves

  • Experience designing for games or interactive media
  • Proficiency with Figma, Sketch, or Adobe XD
  • Understanding of Unity UI systems
  • User research and testing experience
  • Basic front-end development skills (HTML/CSS)
  • Motion graphics and animation skills

Tools & Technologies

  • Figma or similar design tools
  • Adobe Creative Suite
  • Unity UI and Canvas systems
  • Prototyping and user testing tools

Application Requirements

  • Resume highlighting design experience
  • Portfolio showcasing UI/UX design work
  • Case studies demonstrating design process
  • Cover letter explaining your design approach

Community Manager - Detailed Description

Responsibilities

  • Manage Discord server and community engagement
  • Create and schedule social media content
  • Coordinate with streamers and content creators
  • Monitor community feedback and relay to development team
  • Organize community events and game jams
  • Moderate discussions and maintain community guidelines
  • Track and report on community metrics and growth

Nice-to-Haves

  • Experience managing gaming communities
  • Social media marketing experience
  • Content creation skills (video, streaming)
  • Understanding of influencer and creator ecosystems
  • Event planning and coordination experience
  • Basic graphic design skills

Tools & Technologies

  • Discord, Twitter, YouTube, Twitch
  • Social media scheduling tools
  • Analytics and reporting platforms
  • Content creation and editing software

Application Requirements

  • Resume with community management experience
  • Examples of communities you've built or managed
  • Social media portfolio or content examples
  • Cover letter about your community philosophy

Benefits & Perks

Flexible Hours

Work when you're most productive with core overlap hours for collaboration.

Remote-First

Work from anywhere with reliable internet and occasional team meetups.

Learning Stipend

Annual budget for courses, conferences, books, and skill development.

Wellness Time

Mental health days and wellness support for sustainable work-life balance.

Game Jam Days

Regular creative sprints to experiment and explore new ideas together.

Equipment Budget

Hardware and software allowance to set up your ideal workspace.

Our Hiring Process

1

Apply

Submit your application with portfolio and cover letter.

2

Portfolio Review

We review your work and experience for role alignment.

3

Interview(s)

Video conversations with team members and skill assessments.

4

Offer

Contract terms, start date, and welcome to the team!

Apply to Join Atlas Games

Ready to create exceptional games with us? Fill out the application below.

Your full name as it appears on official documents.

We'll use this email for all communication about your application.

Link to your portfolio, Itch.io page, GitHub, or relevant work samples.

Link to your resume (Google Drive, Dropbox, or personal website).

Tell us why you're interested in Atlas Games and this specific role. What unique value do you bring?

Our Culture & Values

At Atlas Games, we're guided by four core values: Craftsmanship in everything we create, Clarity in our communication and processes, Community both within our team and with our players, and Longevity in building games and relationships that endure. We believe the best work happens when passionate individuals collaborate in an environment of mutual respect and creative freedom.

Frequently Asked Questions

Are you fully remote?

Yes, we're a remote-first company. Team members work from anywhere with reliable internet. We prefer South African time zones for easier collaboration but are open to other regions.

Do you offer internships?

We occasionally offer project-based internships for students or recent graduates. These are typically 3-6 month engagements focused on specific skills and portfolio development.

How long is your hiring process?

Our typical process takes 2-4 weeks from application to offer. This includes portfolio review, initial interview, skill assessment, and final conversation with the team.

Contractor vs. full-time?

We start most relationships as contract-to-hire arrangements. This allows both sides to ensure a good fit before transitioning to permanent employment.

What if my role isn't listed?

We're always interested in exceptional talent. If you have skills that could benefit our games, reach out with "Other" selected and explain your unique value proposition.

Do you sponsor visas?

Currently we work with contractors and remote employees. We don't sponsor work visas, but remote collaboration across borders is welcome.

More Questions? Visit Our FAQ

Community Guidelines

We're committed to fostering a respectful, creative, and inclusive community where players can connect, share, and grow together in a safe environment.

Guidelines at a Glance

Be Respectful

Treat all community members with kindness and consideration.

No Harassment or Hate

Zero tolerance for discrimination, hate speech, or personal attacks.

Keep it Safe for Workspaces

Avoid NSFW content and maintain a professional environment.

Stay on Topic

Keep discussions relevant to games and community interests.

Credit Creators

Always attribute artwork, mods, and content to original authors.

Use Spoiler Tags

Mark spoilers appropriately to protect others' experience.

Core Principles

Respect & Inclusion

Welcome everyone regardless of background, skill level, or identity. Celebrate diversity and make newcomers feel at home.

Constructive Feedback

Share opinions thoughtfully. Focus on ideas, not individuals. Help others grow through positive and actionable suggestions.

Safety & Privacy

Protect personal information and create a secure environment. Report concerns promptly and support community well-being.

Fair Play & Integrity

Play games honestly, respect intellectual property, and maintain authenticity in all interactions and content sharing.

Community Rules

  1. No harassment, hate speech, or discrimination. This includes attacks based on race, gender, religion, sexuality, nationality, or any personal characteristic.
  2. No NSFW, gore, or illegal content. Keep all shared content appropriate for a professional environment and comply with local laws.
  3. No doxxing; protect personal data. Never share someone's private information without consent, including real names, addresses, or contact details.
  4. No spam or self-promotion outside designated channels. Avoid repetitive posting, excessive mentions, or promoting external content without permission.
  5. Use spoiler tags for plot/game content when applicable. Respect others' gaming experience by marking major story reveals or puzzle solutions appropriately.
  6. Report bugs via our bug report system, not general chat. Technical issues should be submitted through our official bug report form for proper tracking.
  7. Follow moderators' instructions. Respect moderation decisions and cooperate with community volunteers who help maintain a positive environment.
  8. Use appropriate channels and threading. Post content in relevant channels and use reply threads to keep discussions organized and accessible.
  9. Be patient and helpful with new community members. Remember everyone was new once, and foster an environment where questions are welcomed and answered kindly.

Moderation Policy

Our moderation approach is progressive and considers context, intent, and severity. We aim to educate and guide community members toward positive behavior rather than immediately resorting to punishment.

Typical Enforcement Progression

  1. Warning: First offense explanation and guidance
  2. Temporary Mute: Brief restriction on posting or speaking
  3. Temporary Ban: Short-term removal from community spaces
  4. Permanent Ban: Complete removal for severe or repeated violations

Severe violations such as harassment, hate speech, or illegal content may result in immediate permanent bans without prior warnings.

Appeals Process

If you believe a moderation action was taken in error, you may appeal by emailing atlasgamesstudio22@gmail.com with the subject line "Moderation Appeal". Include relevant context and be respectful in your communication.

Reporting & Enforcement

How to Report Problems

Email Support

For serious violations or detailed reports

Contact Support

Discord Moderators

Use @Moderator ping for immediate attention

@Moderator

Bug Reports

Technical issues and game problems

Report Bug

Our Commitment

  • All reports are reviewed promptly, typically within 24 hours
  • We maintain strict confidentiality for reporters
  • Decisions are made fairly based on evidence and context
  • We provide feedback on actions taken when appropriate

Content & Attribution

  • Share only content you have rights to. Don't post copyrighted material without permission from the rights holder.
  • Credit original authors. Always attribute artwork, mods, guides, and other creative content to their creators.
  • Respect licenses for code, art, and music. Understand and follow the terms of any licenses associated with shared content.
  • We may showcase community work with permission. Outstanding community contributions may be featured in our communications with proper credit.
  • Fair use applies to criticism and commentary. You may discuss and critique games and content within reasonable fair use guidelines.
  • When in doubt, ask first. If you're unsure about sharing something, reach out to moderators or the content creator for guidance.

Safety Resources

Your safety and well-being are important to us. In addition to our community moderation, we encourage you to use platform-specific safety tools:

  • Use Discord's built-in blocking and reporting features
  • Adjust privacy settings to control who can contact you
  • Report harmful content directly to platform moderators
  • Take breaks from community spaces when needed
  • Reach out to mental health resources if you're struggling

Emergency Situations

If you're in immediate danger or experiencing a mental health crisis, contact local emergency services or crisis hotlines in your area immediately.

Consequences & Enforcement

We believe in proportional responses that match the severity and context of violations. Our goal is always to educate and guide toward positive behavior, but we maintain zero tolerance for severe violations that threaten community safety.

Severe violations including harassment, hate speech, doxxing, or illegal content will result in immediate permanent bans without warnings. We prioritize the safety and well-being of our community members above all else.

Ban evasion through alternate accounts or other means will result in permanent bans for all associated accounts and may involve cooperation with platform administrators.

Changes to These Guidelines

These community guidelines may be updated periodically to reflect the evolving needs of our community and changes in platform policies. We'll announce significant changes in our community spaces and update the revision date below.

We encourage community members to review these guidelines regularly and reach out with questions or suggestions for improvement.

Last updated: August 11, 2025

Related Information

Support Center

Get help and find answers to common questions

Privacy Policy

How we handle your personal information

Terms of Service

Legal terms and conditions of use

End User License

Software licensing and usage rights

Core Principles

Respect & Inclusion

Welcome everyone regardless of background, skill level, or identity. Celebrate diversity and make newcomers feel at home.

Constructive Feedback

Share opinions thoughtfully. Focus on ideas, not individuals. Help others grow through positive and actionable suggestions.

Safety & Privacy

Protect personal information and create a secure environment. Report concerns promptly and support community well-being.

Fair Play & Integrity

Play games honestly, respect intellectual property, and maintain authenticity in all interactions and content sharing.

Community Rules

  1. No harassment, hate speech, or discrimination. This includes attacks based on race, gender, religion, sexuality, nationality, or any personal characteristic.
  2. No NSFW, gore, or illegal content. Keep all shared content appropriate for a professional environment and comply with local laws.
  3. No doxxing; protect personal data. Never share someone's private information without consent, including real names, addresses, or contact details.
  4. No spam or self-promotion outside designated channels. Avoid repetitive posting, excessive mentions, or promoting external content without permission.
  5. Use spoiler tags for plot/game content when applicable. Respect others' gaming experience by marking major story reveals or puzzle solutions appropriately.
  6. Report bugs via our bug report system, not general chat. Technical issues should be submitted through our official bug report form for proper tracking.
  7. Follow moderators' instructions. Respect moderation decisions and cooperate with community volunteers who help maintain a positive environment.
  8. Use appropriate channels and threading. Post content in relevant channels and use reply threads to keep discussions organized and accessible.
  9. Be patient and helpful with new community members. Remember everyone was new once, and foster an environment where questions are welcomed and answered kindly.

Moderation Policy

Our moderation approach is progressive and considers context, intent, and severity. We aim to educate and guide community members toward positive behavior rather than immediately resorting to punishment.

Typical Enforcement Progression

  1. Warning: First offense explanation and guidance
  2. Temporary Mute: Brief restriction on posting or speaking
  3. Temporary Ban: Short-term removal from community spaces
  4. Permanent Ban: Complete removal for severe or repeated violations

Severe violations such as harassment, hate speech, or illegal content may result in immediate permanent bans without prior warnings.

Appeals Process

If you believe a moderation action was taken in error, you may appeal by emailing atlasgamesstudio22@gmail.com with the subject line "Moderation Appeal". Include relevant context and be respectful in your communication.

Reporting & Enforcement

How to Report Problems

Email Support

For serious violations or detailed reports

Contact Support

Discord Moderators

Use @Moderator ping for immediate attention

@Moderator

Bug Reports

Technical issues and game problems

Report Bug

Our Commitment

  • All reports are reviewed promptly, typically within 24 hours
  • We maintain strict confidentiality for reporters
  • Decisions are made fairly based on evidence and context
  • We provide feedback on actions taken when appropriate

Content & Attribution

  • Share only content you have rights to. Don't post copyrighted material without permission from the rights holder.
  • Credit original authors. Always attribute artwork, mods, guides, and other creative content to their creators.
  • Respect licenses for code, art, and music. Understand and follow the terms of any licenses associated with shared content.
  • We may showcase community work with permission. Outstanding community contributions may be featured in our communications with proper credit.
  • Fair use applies to criticism and commentary. You may discuss and critique games and content within reasonable fair use guidelines.
  • When in doubt, ask first. If you're unsure about sharing something, reach out to moderators or the content creator for guidance.

Safety Resources

Your safety and well-being are important to us. In addition to our community moderation, we encourage you to use platform-specific safety tools:

  • Use Discord's built-in blocking and reporting features
  • Adjust privacy settings to control who can contact you
  • Report harmful content directly to platform moderators
  • Take breaks from community spaces when needed
  • Reach out to mental health resources if you're struggling

Emergency Situations

If you're in immediate danger or experiencing a mental health crisis, contact local emergency services or crisis hotlines in your area immediately.

Consequences & Enforcement

We believe in proportional responses that match the severity and context of violations. Our goal is always to educate and guide toward positive behavior, but we maintain zero tolerance for severe violations that threaten community safety.

Severe violations including harassment, hate speech, doxxing, or illegal content will result in immediate permanent bans without warnings. We prioritize the safety and well-being of our community members above all else.

Ban evasion through alternate accounts or other means will result in permanent bans for all associated accounts and may involve cooperation with platform administrators.

Changes to These Guidelines

These community guidelines may be updated periodically to reflect the evolving needs of our community and changes in platform policies. We'll announce significant changes in our community spaces and update the revision date below.

We encourage community members to review these guidelines regularly and reach out with questions or suggestions for improvement.

Last updated: August 11, 2025

Related Information

Support Center

Get help and find answers to common questions

Privacy Policy

How we handle your personal information

Terms of Service

Legal terms and conditions of use

End User License

Software licensing and usage rights

Cookie Policy

This policy explains what cookies are, how we use them on our website, and how you can manage your cookie preferences to control your browsing experience.

Last updated: August 11, 2025

Contents

  • What Are Cookies
  • Types We Use
  • Purposes
  • Your Choices
  • Managing Cookies
  • Third Parties
  • Do Not Track
  • Retention
  • Changes
  • Contact

What Are Cookies

Cookies are small text files that are stored on your device (computer, tablet, or mobile) when you visit a website. They allow the website to recognize your device and remember information about your visit, such as your preferred language and other settings.

Local Storage refers to data storage areas in your browser that websites can use to store information locally on your device. Unlike cookies, this data is not automatically sent to the server with every request.

Similar Technologies include web beacons, pixels, and other tracking technologies that help us understand how our website is used and improve the user experience.

Throughout this policy, we use the term "cookies" to refer to cookies and all similar technologies that we may use on our website.

Types of Cookies We Use

Essential / Strictly Necessary
These cookies are essential for the website to function properly. They enable core functionality such as security, network management, and accessibility. You cannot opt out of these cookies.
Performance / Analytics
These cookies help us understand how visitors interact with our website by collecting information anonymously. We use this data to improve site performance and user experience. No personal profiling is conducted.
Functionality
These cookies remember choices you make and provide enhanced, personalized features. For example, they may remember your language preferences or theme settings.
Advertising / Marketing
Currently, we do not use advertising or marketing cookies. If this changes in the future, we will update this policy and provide appropriate controls.
Third-Party
These are cookies set by external services we use, such as embedded content from other platforms or analytics services. These third parties have their own cookie policies.

Purposes for Using Cookies

We use cookies for the following purposes:

  • Maintain site security and core functionality: Ensure the website works properly and protect against security threats
  • Measure traffic and improve content: Understand which pages are most popular and how we can enhance the user experience
  • Remember your preferences: Save settings like theme choices, language preferences, and consent decisions
  • Support community integrations: Enable features like Discord server links and social media sharing
  • Provide consistent experience: Ensure the website behaves consistently across your visits and different pages

Your Choices & Consent

By using our website, you consent to the use of essential cookies that are necessary for the site to function properly. These cookies cannot be disabled without significantly impacting your ability to use our services.

For non-essential cookies, we will seek your consent where required by applicable law. If we implement a cookie consent banner in the future, your choices will be reflected in that interface.

You can manage your cookie preferences through your browser settings (see the Managing Cookies section below) or by using the controls we may provide on our website.

For more information about how we handle your data, please see our Privacy Policy.

Managing Cookies

You can control and manage cookies in several ways. Please note that removing or blocking cookies may impact your user experience and some functionality may not work as intended.

Browser Settings

Most web browsers allow you to control cookies through their settings preferences. Here's how to manage cookies in common browsers:

  • Chrome: Settings > Privacy and security > Cookies and other site data
  • Firefox: Options > Privacy & Security > Cookies and Site Data
  • Safari: Preferences > Privacy > Manage Website Data
  • Edge: Settings > Cookies and site permissions > Cookies and site data

What Happens When You Block Cookies

Blocking or deleting cookies may result in:

  • Loss of website functionality or features
  • Need to re-enter preferences on each visit
  • Inability to access certain parts of our website
  • Repeated consent requests if you delete preference cookies

Third-Party Cookies

Our website may include content from third-party services such as analytics providers, content delivery networks (CDNs), or embedded media players. These third parties may set their own cookies when you interact with their content.

External platforms that we link to, such as Itch.io, Discord, YouTube, and social media sites, operate under their own cookie policies. When you visit these platforms through our links, their privacy and cookie policies apply.

We do not control these third-party cookies and are not responsible for their privacy practices. We recommend reviewing the privacy policies of any third-party services you use.

Common third-party services we may use: Web analytics providers, hosting services, content delivery networks, and embedded social media content.

Do Not Track & Global Privacy Control

Do Not Track (DNT) is a browser setting that requests websites not to track users. Global Privacy Control (GPC) is a newer standard that signals privacy preferences to websites.

Currently, our website may not automatically respond to DNT or GPC signals. However, we are evaluating these technologies and may implement support for them in the future.

In the meantime, you can manage your privacy preferences using the cookie controls described in this policy and through your browser settings.

Cookie Retention

Different types of cookies are stored for different periods of time:

Session Cookies
These are temporary cookies that are deleted when you close your browser. They are used for essential functionality during your visit.
Persistent Cookies
These cookies remain on your device for a set period or until you delete them. Preference cookies may be stored for up to 12 months to remember your choices.
Analytics Cookies
Performance and analytics cookies may be retained for up to 24 months to help us understand long-term trends and improve our website.

Retention periods may vary depending on the specific cookie type and purpose. You can delete cookies at any time through your browser settings.

Changes to This Policy

We may update this Cookie Policy from time to time to reflect changes in our practices, technology, legal requirements, or other factors. When we make changes, we will update the "Last updated" date at the top of this policy.

We encourage you to review this Cookie Policy periodically to stay informed about how we use cookies and similar technologies. Significant changes may be highlighted on our website or communicated through other channels.

Your continued use of our website after any changes indicates your acceptance of the updated Cookie Policy.

Contact Us

If you have any questions about this Cookie Policy or our use of cookies and similar technologies, please don't hesitate to contact us:

Email

atlasgamesstudio22@gmail.com

Subject Line

Please include "Cookie Policy Inquiry" in your subject line for faster processing.

Additional Contact Methods

For more ways to reach us, including our phone number and physical address, please visit our Contact page.

We aim to respond to all cookie policy inquiries within 5 business days.

Related Information

For complete information about our policies and services, please also review:

  • Privacy Policy
  • Terms of Service
  • EULA
  • Refund Policy
  • Support Center

[ { "slug": "mystical-realms-v1-2-0", "title": "Mystical Realms v1.2.0 - Winter Update", "number": "1.2.0", "relatedGame": "mystical-realms", "date": "2024-12-20", "content": "## New Features

- Added snow-covered winter realm with unique enemies and treasures
- Introduced ice magic spells and frost resistance mechanics
- New legendary winter armor sets and weapons
- Holiday-themed quests and seasonal events

## Improvements

- Enhanced combat system responsiveness
- Improved inventory management UI
- Optimized loading times for large areas
- Better controller support for all platforms

## Bug Fixes

- Fixed issue where players could get stuck in certain dungeon areas
- Resolved audio distortion problems in underground levels
- Fixed rare save game corruption issue
- Corrected spell cooldown display inconsistencies", "youtubeEmbed": "https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=dQw4w9WgXcQ", "detailPath": "patch-notes/mystical-realms-v1-2-0/mystical-realms-v1-2-0.html" }, { "slug": "neon-runner-v2-1-5", "title": "Neon Runner v2.1.5 - Performance Boost", "number": "2.1.5", "relatedGame": "neon-runner", "date": "2024-11-30", "content": "## Performance Improvements

- Reduced memory usage by 30% on mobile devices

## New Content

- Added 3 new character skins with unique animations

## Bug Fixes

- Fixed crash issue on older Android devices
- Resolved leaderboard synchronization problems
- Fixed audio cutting out during intense gameplay sections
- Corrected hitbox inconsistencies with certain obstacles", "youtubeEmbed": null, "detailPath": "patch-notes/neon-runner-v2-1-5/neon-runner-v2-1-5.html" }, { "slug": "mystical-realms-v1-1-8", "title": "Mystical Realms v1.1.8 - Bug Fixes", "number": "1.1.8", "relatedGame": "mystical-realms", "date": "2024-11-15", "content": "## Bug Fixes

- Corrected texture loading issues on high-resolution displays

## Minor Improvements

- Slightly increased drop rates for rare crafting materials
- Improved visibility of interactive objects in dark areas
- Enhanced tooltip information for spell descriptions
- Better error handling for save/load operations", "youtubeEmbed": null, "detailPath": "patch-notes/mystical-realms-v1-1-8/mystical-realms-v1-1-8.html" } ]

option.value:
[ { "id": "atlas-games-launch", "slug": "atlas-games-launch", "title": "Welcome to Atlas Games: Our Journey Begins", "author": "Luke Rall", "date": "2024-08-01", "excerpt": "After months of preparation, we're excited to officially launch Atlas Games and share our vision for creating games that truly endure.", "content": "

Welcome to Atlas Games! We're thrilled to finally share our studio with the world and introduce you to our mission: creating games built to endure.

Founded by three passionate game developers, Atlas Games represents our commitment to crafting experiences that stand the test of time. Like Atlas holding up the heavens, we believe games should support and enrich the lives of players for years to come.

Our approach focuses on three core pillars:

  • Craft: Every game we create is meticulously designed with attention to detail and player experience.
  • Community: We build games that bring people together and foster lasting connections.
  • Longevity: Our games are designed to remain engaging and relevant long after their initial release.

Stay tuned for exciting announcements about our upcoming releases and behind-the-scenes looks at our development process!

", "coverImage": "assets/images/blog/atlas-launch-cover.jpg", "tags": ["Studio News", "Launch", "Vision"] }, { "id": "wobbly-wiggles-3-release", "slug": "wobbly-wiggles-3-ultimate-racers-release", "title": "Wobbly Wiggles 3: Ultimate Racers - Diamond & Onyx Editions Now Available!", "author": "Keagan Du Plessis", "date": "2024-11-20", "excerpt": "The highly anticipated third installment in the Wobbly Wiggles series has arrived, bringing physics-based racing to new heights with two premium editions.", "content": "

We're incredibly excited to announce that Wobbly Wiggles 3: Ultimate Racers is now available in both Diamond and Onyx editions!

This latest entry in our beloved Wobbly Wiggles franchise takes the series in an exciting new direction, combining the signature wobbly physics gameplay with high-speed racing action. The result is an experience that's both familiar to series fans and refreshingly innovative.

What's New in Ultimate Racers

Ultimate Racers introduces vehicle-based gameplay while maintaining the chaotic, physics-driven fun that made the series popular. Players can customize their wobbly vehicles, compete on multiple tracks, and experience racing like never before.

Diamond vs Onyx Editions

The Diamond Edition includes the full racing experience with exclusive content and tracks. The Onyx Edition goes even further, adding premium vehicle skins, VIP tournament access, and additional customization options.

Both editions represent months of careful development and playtesting to ensure they meet the high standards our community expects from Atlas Games.

", "coverImage": "assets/images/blog/wobbly-3-release-cover.jpg", "tags": ["Game Release", "Wobbly Wiggles", "Racing"] }, { "id": "indie-game-development-philosophy", "slug": "indie-game-development-philosophy", "title": "Our Philosophy on Indie Game Development", "author": "Liam Schultz", "date": "2024-07-15", "excerpt": "A deep dive into our development philosophy and how we balance creativity, technical excellence, and player satisfaction in every project.", "content": "

As an indie studio, we have the unique opportunity to create games exactly as we envision them, without the constraints often imposed by larger publishers. But with this freedom comes great responsibility.

Our development philosophy centers around several key principles that guide every decision we make:

Player-First Design

Every feature, every mechanic, every visual element is evaluated through the lens of player experience. We ask ourselves: 'Does this make the game more enjoyable? Does it serve the player's journey?'

Technical Excellence

We believe that good code is the foundation of good games. Clean, efficient programming not only makes our games run better but also allows us to iterate faster and implement new features more reliably.

Sustainable Development

We've learned that crunch culture doesn't produce better games—it produces burnout. Our team works sustainable hours, takes breaks when needed, and maintains a healthy work-life balance. This approach actually leads to more creative and innovative solutions.

Community Feedback

Our players are our partners in development. We actively seek feedback during development and post-launch, using it to refine our games and plan future updates.

These principles have guided us through the development of all our titles, from the original Wobbly Wiggles to our upcoming releases.

", "coverImage": "assets/images/blog/dev-philosophy-cover.jpg", "tags": ["Development", "Philosophy", "Indie Games"] }, { "id": "harvest-hustle-postmortem", "slug": "harvest-hustle-development-postmortem", "title": "Harvest Hustle: A Development Postmortem", "author": "Luke Rall", "date": "2024-04-10", "excerpt": "Looking back at the development of Harvest Hustle, from initial concept to release, and the lessons we learned along the way.", "content": "

Harvest Hustle was one of our most ambitious projects to date, combining farming simulation with intense time management gameplay. Now that the game has been out for a few months, it's time to reflect on the development process and share what we learned.

The Initial Concept

The idea for Harvest Hustle came from our desire to create a farming game that felt more dynamic and urgent than traditional titles in the genre. We wanted to capture the peaceful satisfaction of farming while adding excitement through time pressure and resource management.

Development Challenges

One of our biggest challenges was balancing the relaxing nature of farming with the stress of time management. Early playtests showed that players either found the game too stressful or too easy, with little middle ground.

We solved this by implementing multiple difficulty levels and a dynamic difficulty system that adjusts based on player performance. This allows both casual and hardcore players to enjoy the experience at their preferred level of challenge.

What Went Right

  • The art style resonated strongly with players
  • The core gameplay loop proved addictive and engaging
  • Our iterative development process allowed for rapid improvements
  • Community feedback helped shape the final product

What We'd Do Differently

  • Start playtesting earlier in development
  • Implement analytics sooner to better understand player behavior
  • Plan for post-launch content updates from the beginning

Overall, Harvest Hustle taught us valuable lessons about balancing accessibility with depth, and these lessons continue to inform our current projects.

", "coverImage": "assets/images/blog/harvest-hustle-postmortem-cover.jpg", "tags": ["Postmortem", "Harvest Hustle", "Development"] }, { "id": "upcoming-projects-2025", "slug": "upcoming-projects-2025-preview", "title": "2025 Preview: What's Coming from Atlas Games", "author": "Luke Rall", "date": "2024-12-15", "excerpt": "Get a sneak peek at our exciting lineup of games coming in 2025, including Timmy's Revenge, From The Shadows, and more.", "content": "

As we approach 2025, we're excited to share a preview of the amazing projects we have in development. This year promises to be our biggest yet, with several major releases planned across multiple genres.

Timmy's Revenge (Q2 2025)

Our upcoming 2D platformer is shaping up to be something special. Timmy's Revenge combines tight platforming controls with hand-drawn animations and a compelling story of justice and redemption. We're putting extra effort into making sure the game feels responsive and satisfying to play.

From The Shadows (Q3 2025)

This atmospheric horror game represents a new direction for Atlas Games. We're exploring psychological horror through environmental storytelling and stealth-based gameplay. Early feedback from internal testing has been incredibly positive.

Cancer Crusher (Q2 2025)

Perhaps our most meaningful project, Cancer Crusher combines engaging puzzle gameplay with educational content about cancer awareness and prevention. We're working closely with medical professionals to ensure accuracy while maintaining an empowering and hopeful tone.

CapsuleWars Beta

Our strategic battle game is entering beta testing in early 2025. We're looking for players who enjoy deep strategy games to help us refine the balance and mechanics.

Each of these projects represents our commitment to creating diverse, high-quality gaming experiences. We can't wait to share more details as development progresses!

", "coverImage": "assets/images/blog/2025-preview-cover.jpg", "tags": ["Preview", "2025", "Upcoming Games"] } ]

End User License Agreement (EULA)

By installing, downloading, or using any Atlas Games software, you agree to be bound by this End User License Agreement. Please read these terms carefully before proceeding.

Our collection and use of personal information is governed by our Privacy Policy and Cookie Policy.

By using the Software, you consent to the collection and processing of data as described in our privacy policies and this Agreement.

Updates & Patches

We may periodically release updates, patches, and new versions of the Software to add features, fix bugs, improve performance, or address security issues.

These updates may modify, add, or remove features and functionality. Some updates may be automatically installed, while others may require your action to download and install.

Your continued use of the Software after any update constitutes acceptance of the updated Software and any changes to this Agreement that may accompany the update.

System Requirements

Your device must meet the minimum system requirements published for each Software title. The Software may not function properly on devices that do not meet these requirements.

For detailed system requirements for our games, please visit our System Requirements page.

You are responsible for ensuring your device meets the necessary specifications before purchasing or installing the Software.

Health & Safety

Seizure Warning

Some individuals may experience epileptic seizures or other adverse reactions when exposed to flashing lights or patterns in video games. If you or anyone in your family has a history of seizures or epilepsy, consult a physician before using the Software.

General Health Recommendations

  • Take regular breaks during extended play sessions
  • Stop using the Software immediately if you feel unwell
  • Use appropriate lighting and maintain proper posture
  • Follow your device manufacturer's health and safety guidelines

Seek immediate medical attention if you experience seizures, loss of consciousness, or other serious symptoms while using the Software.

Warranty Disclaimer

Term & Termination

Termination by Atlas Games

Effects of Termination

End User License Agreement (EULA)

By installing, downloading, or using any Atlas Games software, you agree to be bound by this End User License Agreement. Please read these terms carefully before proceeding.

Last updated: August 11, 2025

Definitions

For the purposes of this End User License Agreement, the following terms have the meanings set forth below:

  • "Software" means any Atlas Games video game title, including all related updates, patches, downloadable content, assets, documentation, and accompanying materials
  • "You" or "Your" refers to the individual or entity that has obtained a license to use the Software (the end user or licensee)
  • "Atlas Games," "we," "us," or "our" refers to Atlas Games and its affiliates, licensors, and authorized distributors
  • "License" means the limited, non-exclusive rights granted to you under this Agreement to install and use the Software

License Grant

Subject to your compliance with this Agreement, Atlas Games grants you a limited, non-exclusive, non-transferable, and revocable license to:

  • Install and use the Software on compatible devices for personal, non-commercial purposes
  • Make a reasonable number of backup copies for archival purposes only
  • Access and use any online features or services provided with the Software

Single-User License: This license is granted to you individually and may not be shared, transferred, or sublicensed to other users without our express written permission.

Restrictions

You agree not to, and will not permit others to:

  • Redistribute, resell, sublicense, or publicly perform the Software
  • Use the Software for commercial purposes without explicit permission
  • Reverse engineer, decompile, or disassemble the Software except where permitted by law
  • Circumvent or disable any security features or copy protection mechanisms
  • Create unauthorized modifications, cheats, or exploits
  • Remove, alter, or obscure any copyright, trademark, or proprietary notices
  • Use the Software in any way that violates applicable laws or regulations

Important: Violation of these restrictions may result in immediate termination of your license and potential legal action.

Ownership

The Software and all related content, including but not limited to code, graphics, audio, text, and other materials, are owned by Atlas Games and/or its licensors and are protected by copyright, trademark, and other intellectual property laws.

This Agreement grants you only a limited license to use the Software; it does not transfer ownership of the Software or any intellectual property rights to you.

All rights not expressly granted to you in this Agreement are reserved by Atlas Games and its licensors.

User-Generated Content

If the Software allows you to create, share, or upload user-generated content (such as custom levels, screenshots, or other materials):

Your Rights

You retain ownership of your original user-generated content, subject to the rights granted below.

License to Atlas Games

By creating or sharing content through the Software, you grant Atlas Games a non-exclusive, worldwide, royalty-free license to host, display, and distribute your content within the Software and related services.

Content Guidelines

All user-generated content must comply with our Community Guidelines and must not contain illegal, infringing, or harmful material.

We reserve the right to remove any user-generated content that violates these terms or our policies.

Online Services & Third Parties

Some Software features may rely on third-party platforms and services such as Itch.io, Discord, or other distribution and communication platforms.

When using these third-party services, their respective terms of service, privacy policies, and other agreements also apply to your use of those platforms.

Atlas Games is not responsible for the availability, content, or policies of third-party services, and your use of such services is at your own risk.

Data & Privacy

The Software may collect limited data for functionality, security, and support purposes, such as system information, crash reports, and usage analytics.

Our collection and use of personal information is governed by our Privacy Policy and Cookie Policy.

By using the Software, you consent to the collection and processing of data as described in our privacy policies and this Agreement.

Updates & Patches

We may periodically release updates, patches, and new versions of the Software to add features, fix bugs, improve performance, or address security issues.

These updates may modify, add, or remove features and functionality. Some updates may be automatically installed, while others may require your action to download and install.

Your continued use of the Software after any update constitutes acceptance of the updated Software and any changes to this Agreement that may accompany the update.

System Requirements

Your device must meet the minimum system requirements published for each Software title. The Software may not function properly on devices that do not meet these requirements.

For detailed system requirements for our games, please visit our System Requirements page.

You are responsible for ensuring your device meets the necessary specifications before purchasing or installing the Software.

Health & Safety

Seizure Warning

Some individuals may experience epileptic seizures or other adverse reactions when exposed to flashing lights or patterns in video games. If you or anyone in your family has a history of seizures or epilepsy, consult a physician before using the Software.

General Health Recommendations

  • Take regular breaks during extended play sessions
  • Stop using the Software immediately if you feel unwell
  • Use appropriate lighting and maintain proper posture
  • Follow your device manufacturer's health and safety guidelines

Seek immediate medical attention if you experience seizures, loss of consciousness, or other serious symptoms while using the Software.

Warranty Disclaimer

THE SOFTWARE IS PROVIDED "AS IS" AND "AS AVAILABLE" WITHOUT WARRANTIES OF ANY KIND, EITHER EXPRESS OR IMPLIED, INCLUDING BUT NOT LIMITED TO WARRANTIES OF MERCHANTABILITY, FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE, OR NON-INFRINGEMENT.

Atlas Games does not warrant that the Software will be uninterrupted, error-free, secure, or free from viruses or other harmful components.

Some jurisdictions do not allow the exclusion of certain warranties, so some of the above exclusions may not apply to you. In such cases, our warranties are limited to the maximum extent permitted by law.

Limitation of Liability

TO THE MAXIMUM EXTENT PERMITTED BY APPLICABLE LAW, ATLAS GAMES SHALL NOT BE LIABLE FOR ANY INDIRECT, INCIDENTAL, SPECIAL, CONSEQUENTIAL, OR PUNITIVE DAMAGES, INCLUDING BUT NOT LIMITED TO LOSS OF PROFITS, DATA, USE, GOODWILL, OR OTHER INTANGIBLE LOSSES.

In jurisdictions that do not allow the limitation of liability for certain types of damages, our liability shall be limited to the maximum extent permitted by law.

Term & Termination

You represent that you are not located in, or a national of, any country subject to government embargo or that has been designated as a "terrorist supporting" country.

You also agree to comply with all applicable local, state, national, and international laws and regulations in connection with your use of the Software.

Governing Law & Disputes

Any disputes arising from this Agreement or your use of the Software shall be subject to the exclusive jurisdiction of the courts of South Africa.

option.name: originalContent
option.value:
Games Built to Endure

We craft immersive gaming experiences that stand the test of time, bringing players together through innovative storytelling and unforgettable adventures.

Explore Our Games Meet the Team

Why Choose Atlas Games

Innovative Design

We push the boundaries of game design with cutting-edge mechanics and immersive storytelling that keeps players engaged for hours.

Community First

Our games are built around community feedback and collaboration, ensuring every release meets the expectations of our dedicated players.

Uncompromising Quality

Every game undergoes rigorous testing and refinement to deliver polished, bug-free experiences that exceed industry standards.

Lasting Support

We believe in supporting our games long after launch with regular updates, new content, and responsive community engagement.

Featured Games

Discover our latest releases and upcoming titles that are redefining the gaming experience.

Mystic Realms

An epic fantasy RPG where magic and mystery collide in a beautifully crafted open world filled with ancient secrets and powerful artifacts.

Available Now Play Now

Cyber Nexus

A fast-paced cyberpunk adventure that blends strategic combat with immersive storytelling in a neon-lit dystopian future.

Coming Soon Learn More

Stellar Colony

Build and manage your own space colony in this engaging strategy game that combines resource management with exploration and discovery.

Early Access Join Beta

Ancient Legends

Embark on a mythological journey through ancient civilizations, solving puzzles and uncovering lost treasures in this adventure game.

Available Now Download

Quantum Drift

Experience high-speed racing through interdimensional tracks where physics bend and reality shifts in this unique racing game.

In Development Wishlist

Shadow Tactics

Master the art of stealth and strategy in this tactical combat game set in a world where shadows hold the key to victory.

Available Now Play Now
View All Games

Meet Our Team

The talented individuals behind Atlas Games who bring our visions to life.

Sarah Chen

Creative Director

With over 10 years in game design, Sarah leads our creative vision and ensures every game tells a compelling story.

Marcus Rodriguez

Lead Developer

Marcus brings technical excellence to our games, optimizing performance and implementing innovative gameplay mechanics.

Elena Vasquez

Art Director

Elena crafts the visual identity of our games, creating stunning environments and memorable character designs.

Meet the Full Team

About Atlas Games

Founded with a passion for creating extraordinary gaming experiences, Atlas Games has grown from a small indie studio to a recognized name in the industry. We believe that great games have the power to bring people together, inspire creativity, and create lasting memories. Our commitment to innovation, quality, and community drives everything we do.

Learn More About Us

Stay updated with development insights, industry news, and behind-the-scenes content.

March 15, 2025 Read More

March 8, 2025 Read More

Celebrating the incredible achievements and creative content from our amazing gaming community this month.

March 1, 2025 Read More

Studio Boilerplate

Atlas Games is an independent game development studio founded in 2022 and based in Durban, South Africa. The studio specializes in creating compact, polished, and highly replayable indie games that prioritize player engagement over scope. With a focus on craftsmanship and community feedback, Atlas Games has built a reputation for delivering quality experiences across PC and web platforms. The team believes in games that endure, creating lasting value for players through thoughtful design and continuous post-launch support.

For interviews, review codes, additional assets, or any media inquiries, please don't hesitate to reach out. We're always happy to discuss our games and development process.

Press Contact

Email: atlasgamesstudio22@gmail.com
Phone: +27 81 475 2986
Discord: discord.gg/atlasgames

We typically reply to media inquiries within 2–3 business days.

Usage Guidelines

  • Do not modify logos' aspect ratio or colors without permission
  • Provide credit as "© Atlas Games" when using our assets
  • Link back to atlasgames.itch.io when possible in digital coverage
  • For commercial usage beyond editorial coverage, please request permission
  • Screenshots and gameplay footage may be used freely for editorial purposes
  • High-resolution versions of all assets are available upon request

Privacy Policy

We're committed to protecting your privacy and being transparent about how we collect, use, and safeguard your personal information when you use our services.

Last updated: August 11, 2025

Who We Are

Atlas Games is an independent game development studio that creates immersive gaming experiences. We develop and publish video games across multiple platforms and operate this website to share information about our games, team, and development process.

You can contact us at atlasgamesstudio22@gmail.com for any questions about this privacy policy or our data practices.

For additional ways to reach us, please visit our Contact page.

Information We Collect

We collect information you provide directly to us and some information automatically when you use our website. We do not knowingly collect sensitive personal information such as health data, financial information, or other protected categories.

Information You Provide:

  • Contact information (name, email address) when you fill out forms on our website
  • Messages and inquiries submitted through our contact forms
  • Job application information including resumes and portfolio links
  • Bug reports including system information, error descriptions, and reproduction steps
  • Newsletter subscription email addresses
  • Comments or feedback you choose to share with us

Information Collected Automatically:

  • Usage data such as pages viewed, time spent on site, and referral sources
  • Device information including browser type, operating system, and IP address
  • Cookies and similar tracking technologies (see our Cookie Policy for details)

How We Use Information

We use the information we collect for the following purposes:

  • Provide and improve our services: Respond to your inquiries, process job applications, and fix bugs or technical issues you report
  • Communication: Send you newsletters and development updates if you've opted in, and respond to your messages
  • Website improvement: Analyze usage patterns to enhance user experience and optimize our website performance
  • Security and fraud prevention: Protect our services and users from abuse, spam, and security threats
  • Legal compliance: Meet our legal obligations and protect our legitimate business interests

Opt-out: You can unsubscribe from our newsletter at any time by clicking the unsubscribe link in any email or contacting us directly.

Legal Bases for Processing

We process your personal information based on the following legal grounds:

  • Contract: To provide services you've requested, such as responding to contact forms or processing job applications
  • Legitimate interests: To improve our games and website, ensure security, and operate our business effectively
  • Consent: For newsletter subscriptions, cookies, and other optional services where you've given explicit permission
  • Legal obligations: To comply with applicable laws and regulations

Cookies & Similar Technologies

We use cookies and similar technologies to enhance your browsing experience and analyze website usage. Cookies are small text files stored on your device that help us remember your preferences and understand how you interact with our site.

Types of Cookies We Use:

  • Essential cookies: Required for basic website functionality
  • Analytics cookies: Help us understand website usage and performance
  • Preference cookies: Remember your settings and choices

For detailed information about our cookie practices and how to manage your preferences, please see our Cookie Policy.

Analytics & Third Parties

We may use third-party services to help us operate and improve our website, including analytics providers, hosting services, and content delivery networks. These service providers may collect information about your use of our website.

We do not sell your personal data to third parties for their marketing purposes.

Our website may contain links to external sites such as Itch.io, Discord, and social media platforms. These third-party websites have their own privacy policies that govern how they collect and use your information. We encourage you to review their policies before providing any personal information.

When you interact with these external platforms through our links, their privacy policies apply to any information you share with them.

Data Sharing & Security

Data Sharing

We may share your information with trusted service providers who help us operate our website and business, such as hosting providers, email services, and analytics platforms. These providers are bound by confidentiality agreements and are only permitted to use your information for the specific services they provide to us.

Security Measures

We implement administrative, technical, and physical safeguards designed to protect your personal information against unauthorized access, disclosure, alteration, and destruction. These measures include:

  • Secure server infrastructure and encrypted data transmission
  • Access controls and authentication requirements for our systems
  • Regular security updates and monitoring
  • Employee training on data protection practices

Important: While we strive to protect your information, no method of transmission over the internet or electronic storage is 100% secure. We cannot guarantee absolute security.

Data Retention

We retain your personal information only as long as necessary to fulfill the purposes for which it was collected, comply with our legal obligations, resolve disputes, and enforce our agreements.

Retention Periods:

  • Contact inquiries: Retained for up to 2 years to provide ongoing support
  • Job applications: Retained for up to 1 year for potential future opportunities
  • Bug reports: Retained until the issue is resolved and for quality assurance purposes
  • Newsletter subscriptions: Retained until you unsubscribe
  • Website analytics: Aggregated data may be retained indefinitely for business insights

Your Rights

Depending on your location and applicable privacy laws, you may have the following rights regarding your personal information:

  • Access: Request information about what personal data we hold about you
  • Correction: Request correction of inaccurate or incomplete information
  • Deletion: Request deletion of your personal information in certain circumstances
  • Objection: Object to certain types of processing of your information
  • Restriction: Request that we limit how we use your information
  • Portability: Request a copy of your information in a portable format
  • Withdraw consent: Withdraw consent for processing based on consent

How to Exercise Your Rights

To exercise any of these rights, please contact us at atlasgamesstudio22@gmail.com with your specific request. We may need to verify your identity before processing your request to protect your privacy and security.

We will respond to your request within a reasonable timeframe as required by applicable law, typically within 30 days of verification.

International Transfers

Your personal information may be transferred to and processed in countries other than your country of residence. These countries may have different data protection laws than those in your jurisdiction.

When we transfer your information internationally, we implement appropriate safeguards to protect your privacy, such as contractual protections, adequacy decisions, or other legally recognized transfer mechanisms.

By using our services, you consent to the transfer of your information to other countries as necessary to provide our services and fulfill our legitimate business purposes.

Children's Privacy

Our website and services are not directed to children under the age of 13. We do not knowingly collect personal information from children under 13 years of age. If you are under 13, please do not provide any personal information on our website.

If we become aware that we have collected personal information from a child under 13, we will take steps to delete such information from our systems as soon as reasonably possible.

If you believe we may have collected information from a child under 13, please contact us immediately at atlasgamesstudio22@gmail.com.

Contact Us

If you have any questions about this Privacy Policy or our data practices, please contact us:

Email

atlasgamesstudio22@gmail.com

Phone

+27 81 475 2986

Additional Contact Methods

For more ways to reach us, including our physical address and social media channels, please visit our Contact page.

We strive to respond to all privacy-related inquiries within 5 business days.

Changes to This Policy

We may update this Privacy Policy from time to time to reflect changes in our practices, technology, legal requirements, or for other operational reasons. When we make changes, we will update the "Last updated" date at the top of this policy.

We encourage you to review this Privacy Policy periodically to stay informed about how we protect your information. Your continued use of our services after any changes indicates your acceptance of the updated policy.

For significant changes to this policy, we may provide additional notice through our website or other communication channels.

Related Information

For more information about our policies and services, please review:

  • Terms of Service
  • End User License Agreement
  • Refund Policy
  • Cookie Policy
  • Support Center
  • Report a Bug

Atlas Games

Creating immersive gaming experiences that bring players together and stand the test of time.

123 Game Development Ave
Studio City, CA 90210
